docs.snippet: The Cuban peso, which has shown considerable strength in recent weeks, rose 28 points yesterday to 100.28 cents in terms of the United States dollar. This was the highest level in several years.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cuban peso, which has shown considerable strength in recent weeks, rose 28 points yesterday to 100.28 cents in terms of the United States dollar. This was the highest level in several years.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 -- Sumner Welles, Under-Secretary of State, has been selected to head the United States delegation to the Pan-American Conference in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, reliable diplomatic sources reported today. The governing board of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 -- Sumner Welles, Under-Secretary of State, has been selected to head the United States delegation to the Pan-American Conference in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, reliable diplomatic sources reported today. The governing board of the Pan-American Union set Jan. 15 as the date of the gathering.

headline.main: WELLES TO ATTEND AMERICAS' PARLEY; Pan American Union Sets Jan. 15 as Meeting Date at Rio de Janeiro

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Dec. 20 -- The Argentine Ambassador to Italy, Dr. Manuel Malbran, who came here a month ago to report to his government on the European situation, will leave for Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, tomorrow en route to Rome to resume his...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Dec. 20 -- The Argentine Ambassador to Italy, Dr. Manuel Malbran, who came here a month ago to report to his government on the European situation, will leave for Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, tomorrow en route to Rome to resume his post, it was stated today.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 -- About 425 names of individuals and companies, including 250 Japanese firms and persons in Latin-American republics, were added tonight to the blacklist, which prevents them from trading with the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 -- About 425 names of individuals and companies, including 250 Japanese firms and persons in Latin-American republics, were added tonight to the blacklist, which prevents them from trading with the United States.

headline.main: 425 MORE NAMES PUT ON BLACKLIST; Supplement Adds 250 Japanese Firms and Persons in Latin America to Trade Ban MANY ACTING AS 'CLOAKS' Sixth Anti-Axis Ban by State Department Is the Second Since War Began in East
